channel.title: Comments on: Code Sharing (PowerShell): Update Octopus variable via Octopus API
channel.description: A blog about things I learn at the keyboard: DevOps, CI/CD, Cloud, Automation, to name a few....

item.title: By: Marcus
item.dc:creator: Marcus
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/blog/2017/update-octopus-variable-via-octopus-api/#comment-3607">Ashutosh Pathak</a>.
Ashutosh,
This example uses the .NET client library, but yes, it is possible via Octopus REST API's as well. There are a bunch of scripts in this OctopusDeploy-Api repo on GitHub: https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/OctopusDeploy-Api/tree/master/REST/PowerShell/Variables
Marcus
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Ashutosh Pathak.

Ashutosh,

This example uses the .NET client library, but yes, it is possible via Octopus REST API’s as well. There are a bunch of scripts in this OctopusDeploy-Api repo on GitHub: https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/OctopusDeploy-Api/tree/master/REST/PowerShell/Variables

Marcus

item.title: By: Ashutosh Pathak
item.dc:creator: Ashutosh Pathak
item.description: Is there any way to update via octopus Rest APIs ?
item.content:encoded: Is there any way to update via octopus Rest APIs ?
